article:
I used to be a shy girl who never joined in any activities. When   _  invited me,
I always  _  and said, "I am only a small potato, I don't want to be
the center of  _  ." Even in class when the teacher questioned us, I
never  _  my hand because I  _  that others might laugh at me if I
made a mistake.
But everything changed after I joined my class debating  team. I didn't want to join at first, for I was afraid to talk in front of a big   _  .However, my good friend
tried to  _  me to go. She said, "I think you should break out of
your shyness, otherwise it will be hard for you to  _  in this society."
She was right. I was always so shy that I missed many   _  . In fact, I used to
have a beautiful  _  that one day I would become a news broadcaster but I
knew it was unlikely because of my shyness.
I thought for a long time and then I decided to have a go. How   _  I was! I
felt I had made the first step in  _  my cowardice . I   stayed up  late at night to
prepare for the coming debate. But the first debate was not what I had  _  .
I was so  _  when I went to my seat. I dared not look at the audience and  _  . I shook like a leaf because I felt as if all the people were  staring at  me. I was so nervous that I nearly forgot what I had to say. My three teammates
had the same  _  . We failed in the first debate.
But our teachers and classmates didn't blame us, they said, "You did very well,   after all  ,
this is your first time." In the second competition, I  _  my
attention on the subject of the debate. I operated well with my team members
and we succeeded! We won the warmest applause  from the audience and the judges!
